question: Which of the following is the meaning of the word “secular”?
option3: Freedom of religion and worship to all citizens
explanation: The word secular means not subject to or bound by religious rule or not belonging to or living in a monastic or other order. Secular means non-religious. A secular religion is a communal belief system that often rejects or neglects the metaphysical aspects of the supernatural, commonly associated with traditional religion, instead placing typical religious qualities in earthly entities.
